body_html:
I encounter the same problem. But in my version of pytorch (ubuntu16.04+py2.7+anaconda), nn.Softmax only allows 2D tensor, while nn.LogSoftmax 's behavior is exactly the same.
I like the idea that adds an optional dim argument, that would be much more convenient.
body_text:
I encounter the same problem. But in my version of pytorch (ubuntu16.04+py2.7+anaconda), nn.Softmax only allows 2D tensor, while nn.LogSoftmax 's behavior is exactly the same.
I like the idea that adds an optional dim argument, that would be much more convenient.
body:
I encounter the same problem. But in my version of pytorch (ubuntu16.04+py2.7+anaconda), `nn.Softmax` only allows 2D tensor, while `nn.LogSoftmax` 's behavior is exactly the same.
I like the idea that adds an optional `dim` argument, that would be much more convenient.
